enrolled-dateline.#text: Begun and held at the City of Washington on Thursday, the third day of January, two thousand and thirteen

congress.#text: One Hundred Thirteenth Congress of the United States of America

official-title.#text: To amend the District of Columbia Home Rule Act to provide that the District of Columbia Treasurer or one of the Deputy Chief Financial Officers of the Office of the Chief Financial Officer of the District of Columbia may perform the functions and duties of the Office in an acting capacity if there is a vacancy in the Office.

role.#text: Speaker of the House of Representatives.
Vice President of the United States and President of the Senate.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: District of Columbia Chief Financial Officer Vacancy Act
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: District of Columbia Chief Financial Officer Vacancy Act

text.#text: This Act may be cited as the

header.#text: Authorizing district of columbia treasurer or deputy chief financial officer of office of chief financial officer of the district of columbia to serve as acting chief financial officer in event of vacancy in office

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: (sec. 1–204.24(b), D.C. Official Code) is amended by adding at the end the following new paragraph:
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Section 424(b) of the District of Columbia Home Rule Act
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: District of Columbia Home Rule Act/s:424/ss:b

header.#text: Authorizing service in acting capacity in event of vacancy in office

text.#text: the District of Columbia Treasurer shall serve as the Chief Financial Officer in an acting capacity, subject to the time limitation of subparagraph (B); or

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: in an acting capacity, subject to the time limitation of subparagraph (B).

text.#text: the Mayor may direct one of the Deputy Chief Financial Officers of the Office referred to in subparagraphs (A) through (D) of subsection (a)(3) to serve as the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: because the Chief Financial Officer has died, resigned, or is otherwise unable to perform the functions and duties of the

text.#text: Except as provided in clause (ii), if there is a vacancy in the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: under such clause if the individual did not serve as the District of Columbia Treasurer or as one of such Deputy Chief Financial Officers of the Office of the Chief Financial Officer (as the case may be) for at least 90 days during the 1-year period which ends on the date the vacancy occurs.

text.#text: Notwithstanding clause (i), an individual may not serve as the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: may not be filled by the service of any individual in an acting capacity under subparagraph (A) after the expiration of the 210-day period which begins on the date the vacancy occurs.
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Office of the Chief Financial Officer

header.#text: Authorizing treasurer or deputy CFO to perform duties in acting capacity in event of vacancy in office

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: (sec. 1–204.24(b)(2)(D), D.C. Official Code) is amended by striking
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: District of Columbia Home Rule Act/s:424/ss:b/p:2/sp:D

text.#text: The amendments made by this Act shall apply with respect to vacancies occurring on or after the date of the enactment of this Act.

{http://purl.org/dc/elements/1.1/}title.#text: HR 1246 ENR: District of Columbia Chief Financial Officer Vacancy Act
